definition: frontier fortress
suffix of a noun of locality
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: The twice part depicts the frontier fortress.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是对边塞地区的描绘。

sentences.english: Li Yi was a famous poet in the middle of Tang Dynasty .
sentences.chinese: 李益是中唐前期著名的诗人，以擅长写边塞诗闻名。

sentences.english: The are some confusion phenomena about the conception of frontier fortress poem.
sentences.chinese: 关于边塞诗的概念存在混乱现象。

sentences.english: An old man living in the frontier area lost one of his horses .
sentences.chinese: 边塞地区，有一个老人的马跑丢了。

sentences.english: It is always regarded that frontier fortress was a tipical theme in piping time of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 边塞诗一向被认为是属于盛唐的一个题材。

sentences.english: Apart from the landscape style poems, Wang Wei is also remarkable in the composition of frontier fortress poems.
sentences.chinese: 王维除山水诗外，边塞诗也写得很出色。

sentences.english: The Tang poems which depict the frontier wars are valuable poems which reflect the patriotic feelings of the Han people at that time.
sentences.chinese: 反映唐王朝边塞战争的诗歌多是充满爱国激情的好诗。

sentences.english: Run in the territory of certain words, that is, folk frontier fortress.
sentences.chinese: 某些词跑在疆域，就是边塞民歌。

sentences.english: Yang Mu is a representative poet of "School of New Frontier Fortress Poetry" at the present age of China.
sentences.chinese: 杨牧是我国当代著名的“新边塞诗派”的代表诗人。

definition: border station/strategic defensive position on frontier
beyond the Great Wall
to garrison the border/to guard the frontier/exile to a border garrison post
border area/borderland/frontier/frontier region
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
desert
North of Xinjiang
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
to guard
Liangzhou district of Wuwei city 武威市[Wu3 wei1 shi4], Gansu
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Liaodong peninsula between Bohai 渤海 and Yellow sea/east and south of Liaoning province/east of Liao river 遼河|辽河
Anxi county, former name of Guazhou county 瓜州縣|瓜州县[Gua1 zhou1 xian4] in Jiuquan 酒泉[Jiu3 quan2], Gansu
Youzhou, ancient province in north Hebei and Liaoning/Fanyang 範陽|范阳 ancient city near modern Beijing
beyond the pass, i.e. the region north and east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1] or the region west of Jiayu Pass 嘉峪關|嘉峪关[Jia1 yu4 guan1] or both
Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu
